result.execSummary:
The defendant Greg J Benning was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription [Modifiers: Penalty-Fraud/Obtaining Prescriptions], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay court costs.     Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
---------------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
---------------------------------
with Huber privileges.  IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess Huber funds be applied toward any and all outstanding restitution, fines/costs while serving his/her mandatory jail sentence.

Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
---------------------------------

No contact with James C. Ewert. No medications or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
---------------------------------

Signed bond filed with the court.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Any prescribed medication is to be taken within the terms / limits of the prescription.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH J.E., M.E. OR T.H.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Defendant Greg J Benning in court with attorney Roger C. Pyzyk.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.  Arraignment scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
